meanings.sent1: She put on her galoshed to keep her feet dry in the rain.
meanings.sent2: The children wore galoshed over their shoes to play in the puddles.
meanings.sent3: The bright red galoshed matched her raincoat perfectly.
meanings.sent4: His galoshed were like shields against the wet weather.
meanings.sent5: The sound of her galoshed splashing in the rain was music to her ears.

meanings.sent1: He galoshed his feet before stepping out into the storm.
meanings.sent2: They always galoshed when it rained to avoid wet socks.
meanings.sent3: She galoshed happily, knowing her shoes would stay dry.
meanings.sent4: The children galoshed around the yard, enjoying the rain.
meanings.sent5: Remember to galoshed before going outside to protect your shoes.

meanings.definition: Galoshes worn as protection against rain or snow
meanings.sent1: His old galoshed were starting to show signs of wear.
meanings.sent2: She bought a new pair of galoshed for the upcoming winter.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to play with the dangling straps on the galoshed.
meanings.sent4: The galoshed stood by the door, ready for the next rainy day.
meanings.sent5: The colorful galoshed brightened up the dreary weather.
